q: How can I apply to the Tajweed program?
a: Complete the online application form available on our website. Submit required documents including educational certificates and a letter of motivation. Entrance interviews are conducted for shortlisted candidates.
Yes, we offer limited hostel facilities for full-time students from outside the city. Accommodation includes meals, study areas, and supervised living environment. Apply early as spaces are limited.

q: How do I submit a question to Dar-ul-Ifta?
a: Use the question submission form on our Resources page. Provide detailed context for your query. Our qualified scholars will respond via email within 7-10 business days.
Regular classes run from 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM, Saturday to Thursday. Evening programs are available from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM. Friday is reserved for congregational prayers and community activities.

q: What are the fee structures for different programs?
a: Fees vary by program and duration. Basic programs start from $200/semester. Scholarships and payment plans are available for deserving students. Contact admissions office for detailed fee structure.

q: Do you offer certificates upon completion?
a: Yes, we provide certificates for all completed programs. Certificates are recognized by major Islamic institutions globally. Transcripts and recommendations are also available for further studies.
